Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 34th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1966...
Injured on 7/10/1967 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 4/18/1972, off Bob Lee (NYM)...
Traded from St. Louis to Cleveland on 6/12/1972 (Going to STL: P M. Proly. Going to CLE: LF J. Kennedy, 3B M. Trillo)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/20/1972, off Al Downing (NYY)...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (A) on 6/20/1972...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1973...
Injured on 6/21/1975 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1975...
Drove in 6 runs against California on 8/14/1976...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1976...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1977...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/3/1978 to a 3-year deal worth $4,290,000 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Boston on 5/9/1978...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/12/1978, hitting .464 with 4 HR, 12 RBI...
